intro: Theligonum cynocrambe, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it flowers in the summer months. Theligonum cynocrambe is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
